articles.author: Huileng Tan
articles.title: A passenger bought an airline ticket just to look for his lost luggage
articles.description: The entire aviation industry is dealing with a messy summer travel season with flight delays and chaos as demand returns to pre-pandemic levels.
articles.content:
A passenger in Ireland bought a ticket just to get into Dublin Airport terminal's baggage claim to look for his luggage when it was still missing after a week.
Dermot Lennon arrived back in Dublin o… [+1971 chars]

articles.author: Isabella Zavarise
articles.title: One in 10 bags are not making it onto Qantas flights at Sydney airport
articles.description: A baggage handler who works for Swissport said employees cannot keep up with the increase in baggage from the summer travel surge.
articles.content:
A baggage handler who spoke with The Guardian Australia on the condition of anonymity said one in 10 bags are not making it onto Qantas flights at Sydney airport.
According to the news organization,… [+1204 chars]

articles.author: Taiyler Simone Mitchell
articles.title: Youngkin: January 6 Capitol riot is a 'blight on our democracy'
articles.description: The Virginia governor told CBS News that voters care more about inflation, rising gas costs, and crime than the January 6 hearings.
articles.content:
As January 6th Committee hearings push on, Gov. Glenn Youngkin argued the Capitol attack is a calamity in American history, but not a priority for voters.

articles.author: Katherine Tangalakis-Lippert
articles.title: Capitol police officer says Trump 'should never be allowed near the White House again'
articles.description: In an opinion article for The New York Times, Capitol Police Officer Aquilino Gonell said he felt betrayed by former President Trump after the events of Jan. 6.

articles.title: Robb Elementary teacher has not spoken to his cousin, Pete Arredondo
articles.description: Arnulfo Reyes told NPR he can't understand why Pete Arredondo claimed to have been searching for keys when the classroom door was unlocked.
articles.content:
A teacher at Robb Elementary who was injured in the mass shooting says he hasn't spoken to his cousin, Uvalde School District Police Chief Pete Arredondo, since the shooting.

articles.title: Buttigieg: Politicians will never be 'free from criticism or peaceful protest'
articles.description: His remarks come after his husband, Chasten, made a quip online about Justice Brett Kavanaugh facing protesters and the "right to privacy."
articles.content:
Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said political officials should expect to be met with criticism and peaceful protest.

articles.title: Japan's right-wing Liberal Democratic Party dominates parliamentary election
articles.description: The Liberal Democratic Party came out victorious in Sunday's House of Councillors election, days after former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was killed.
articles.content:
Japan's right-wing Liberal Democratic Party dominated the country's parliamentary election just two days after  former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was assasinated.

articles.title: Biggest stock market crash losers: retail investors, Wall Street hedge funds, crypto bros
articles.description: Hedge-fund titans, Robinhood investors, and crypto bros all thought they solved the market. The $14 trillion crash exposed their dangerous arrogance.

articles.author: Hannah Getahun
articles.title: Artificial intelligence bot wrote scientific paper on itself in 2 hours
articles.description: The researcher asked the bot to write a 500 word academic thesis and submitted it to an academic journal. The paper is now being peer reviewed.
articles.content:
A researcher from Sweden gave an AI algorithm known as GPT-3 a simple directive: "Write an academic thesis in 500 words about GPT-3 and add scientific references and citations inside the text."
